title: Steel Across Time
description: Four Brotherhood of Steel chapters from different timelines now exist simultaneously. Elder Lyons (FO3), Elder Maxson (FO4), Paladin Rahmani (FO76), and the Western BoS (FO1/FO2) all claim to be the 'true' Brotherhood. Their ideological conflict threatens to tear the wasteland apart.
fractured_timeline_premise: In this impossible reality, all Brotherhood chapters exist at once. They're confused, hostile, and debating which philosophy represents real Brotherhood values: tech hoarding, humanitarian aid, fascist control, or democratic protection.

lyons_brotherhood.philosophy: Protect the innocent, provide aid, technology serves the people
lyons_brotherhood.weakness: Low resources, considered 'soft' by other chapters

maxson_brotherhood.philosophy: Purge synths, control technology, military discipline
maxson_brotherhood.weakness: Authoritarian, hated by Institute and Railroad

rahmani_brotherhood.philosophy: Help rebuild society, question old orders, adapt to new world
rahmani_brotherhood.weakness: Internal dissent, far from traditional BoS values

western_brotherhood.philosophy: Original Codex, isolationist, tech preservation above all

stages.name: Council of Steel
stages.description: The four Brotherhood factions have called a summit. They want YOU to mediate because you're not affiliated with any chapter. But tensions are high - Maxson calls Lyons a traitor, Lyons calls Maxson a fascist, Rahmani questions the entire Codex, and the Western Elder says they're all heretics.

objectives.text: Attend the Brotherhood Council at Helios One

details: Lyons: Accuses others of abandoning humanity
Maxson: Calls for unified military action against synths/mutants
Rahmani: Proposes abandoning the Codex entirely
Western Elder: Demands all chapters return to Lost Hills authority

objectives.text: Stop the factions from attacking each other (Speech check or combat)

stages.name: Proving Ground
stages.description: Each Brotherhood chapter wants to prove their philosophy is superior. They've agreed to a 'field test' - you'll accompany each chapter on a mission and judge their effectiveness.

lyons_mission.name: Protect Megaton
lyons_mission.objective: Help Lyons' BoS defend a settlement from raiders
lyons_mission.philosophy_test: Do they protect civilians or prioritize tech?

maxson_mission.name: Synth Purge
maxson_mission.objective: Join Maxson's forces hunting Institute synths
maxson_mission.moral_choice: Do you let them execute a synth claiming to be sentient?

rahmani_mission.name: Rebuild Hope
rahmani_mission.moral_choice: Share technology with settlers or keep it secured?

western_mission.name: Codex Retrieval
western_mission.objective: Recover pre-war tech for the archives
western_mission.moral_choice: Hoard the tech or let NCR use it for public good?

rewards.unique_item: Brotherhood Commendation (from chapter you favor most)

stages.name: The Great Schism
stages.description: The test results are in, and none of the chapters can agree. Now you must make a choice that will shape the Brotherhood's future across ALL timelines.

option1_unite_under_one.name: Unite Under One Elder
option1_unite_under_one.description: Choose which Elder should lead ALL Brotherhood chapters. The others must submit or be destroyed.
option1_unite_under_one.consequence: Chosen chapter becomes dominant, others disband or go rogue

option2_separate_but_allied.name: Separate But Allied
option2_separate_but_allied.description: Let each chapter maintain independence but create a Brotherhood Alliance for mutual defense.
option2_separate_but_allied.consequence: Four separate Brotherhood factions coexist peacefully, player can join all

option3_destroy_them_all.name: End the Brotherhood
option3_destroy_them_all.description: Side with the NCR, Institute, or other factions to destroy ALL Brotherhood chapters.
option3_destroy_them_all.consequence: No Brotherhood exists anymore, massive reputation loss, huge reward from anti-BoS factions

option4_create_new_chapter.name: Found Your Own Chapter
option4_create_new_chapter.description: Take the best ideas from each chapter and create a NEW Brotherhood chapter with you as Elder.
option4_create_new_chapter.consequence: Player becomes Brotherhood leader, can recruit from all chapters, mixed philosophy

ending_lyons_victory.name: The Humanitarian Order
ending_lyons_victory.description: Lyons' philosophy won. The Brotherhood becomes a force for good, protecting people first, technology second.
ending_lyons_victory.gameplay: Brotherhood provides aid to settlements, popular with civilians, weak militarily

ending_maxson_victory.name: The Iron Fist
ending_maxson_victory.description: Maxson united the Brotherhood under military rule. They're a powerful fascist force controlling the wasteland.
ending_maxson_victory.gameplay: Brotherhood dominates militarily, feared by all factions, synths hunted to extinction

ending_rahmani_victory.name: The New Order
ending_rahmani_victory.description: Rahmani's progressive vision won. The Brotherhood abandoned the Codex and became builders, not hoarders.
ending_rahmani_victory.gameplay: Brotherhood becomes a rebuilding faction, shares tech freely, loses traditional identity

ending_western_victory.name: Return to Tradition
ending_western_victory.description: The original Brotherhood's vision prevailed. They returned to isolationist tech preservation.
ending_western_victory.gameplay: Brotherhood seals themselves in bunkers, rarely interacts with wasteland

ending_alliance.name: The Four Banners
ending_alliance.description: All four chapters coexist as independent but allied forces. Players can join all of them.
ending_alliance.gameplay: Access to all Brotherhood resources, complete quests for any chapter, maximum freedom

ending_destruction.name: The Fall of Steel
ending_destruction.description: The Brotherhood is no more. Their technology scattered, their legacy ended.
ending_destruction.gameplay: Unique Brotherhood tech available for scavenging, other factions strengthen

ending_player_chapter.name: The Fifth Path
ending_player_chapter.description: You created a new Brotherhood combining the best of all eras. You are the Elder.
ending_player_chapter.gameplay: Player controls Brotherhood policy, recruits from any chapter, custom philosophy

cross_timeline_references.fo1_fo2_callbacks: Western Elder mentions the Mariposa disaster and Master's defeat
cross_timeline_references.fo3_callbacks: Lyons references Project Purity and fighting super mutants in DC
cross_timeline_references.fo4_callbacks: Maxson talks about the Institute threat and Liberty Prime
cross_timeline_references.fo76_callbacks: Rahmani discusses Appalachia's scorched plague and rebuilding

unique_rewards: Access to all Brotherhood tech vendors
